description.narrative: Increased non-financial contributions from individual donors, private and public sector partners for the realization of boys' and girls' rights., which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas (Covid), Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, engaged citizens, including boys, girls and families, millennials, individual donors and private sector partners, are driving public action for the realization of children's rights.

title.narrative: Increased non-financial contributions from individual donors, private and public sector partners for the realization of boys’ and girls’ rights.

description.narrative: In response to increasing overweight and obesity rates in Brazil, UNICEF advocated for the introduction of easy-to-understand food and beverage labels alerting about high levels of sugar, salt and sodium and assessed the influence of marketing practices specifically targeting children. New industry regulations on front labelling are expected to be introduced in 2020. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/02/2020

title.narrative: Number of company policies and industry regulations influenced to be in line with CRB principles
